interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Graffiti Bridge
Review Date: 2016/06/26
Store: Prince  (Actor, Director, Writer),     Morris Day  (Actor)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Music Artists, Prince
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Graffiti Bridge (DVD)', 'In a sequel of sorts to Purple Rain, the artist formerly known as Princestruggles musically with Morris Day for control of the nightclub thatthe two co-own in this dramatic musical fantasy. There is the power offaith--in oneself and in a higher power. There is the power of love.There is the never-ending struggle between good and bad. And there isthe power of music. Graffiti Bridge.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', "A sort of fairy-tale sequel to Prince's enormously successful", 'Purple Rain', ", 1990's", 'Graffiti Bridge', "finds his purple highness not only singing and acting, but writing and directing, too. His performance suffers on all fronts. The film isn't a disaster, but it's safe to predict completist fans will make up most of its viewers. In the earlier film, Prince (known as the Kid) was fighting for his place on stage. This time he's fighting to keep his club safe from the money-grubbing hands of his musical rival, the Time's Morris Day, now a nightclub mogul. Day embodies spiritual, sexual, and economic corruption, while the Kid stands for salvation through music and a more redemptive form of lust.", 'The graffiti bridge conceit--a metaphor for a place of rejuvenation and artistic inspiration--is intriguing. Unfortunately, the bridge itself is merely a prop in a Paisley Park soundstage. Where', 'Purple Rain', 'was a movie that set new standards for lensing musical performances,', 'Graffiti Bridge', 'feels like a music video masquerading as a movie. Lucky for us, Prince cast the honey-voiced poet and performer Ingrid Chavez as Aura, part muse and part angel to both Day and the Kid. Her beauty and charisma ignite every frame she graces.', '--Michael Mikesell', 'Set Contains:', 'Bonus features are minimal but apt: a surprisingly good movie trailer and a quartet of relevant music videos, three drawn from the film and one, "Question of U," a characteristically electric concert clip.', '--Michael Mikesell', 'See more']
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Musicals & Performing Arts/Musicals, Drama', 'Format': 'Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled, Surround Sound', 'Contributor': 'Phillip C, Morris Day, Damon Dickson, Levi Seacer Jr., Kirk Johnson, Ingrid Chavez, Miko Weaver, Prince, Jerome Benton, The Time, Rosie Gaines, Michael Bland, Tony MosleyPhillip C, Morris Day, Damon Dickson, Levi Seacer Jr., Kirk Johnson, Ingrid Chavez, Miko Weaver, Prince, Jerome Benton, The Time, Rosie Gaines, Michael Bland, Tony Mosley  See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 4.0)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.75 x 0.5 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Director': 'Prince', 'Media Format': 'Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen, Subtitled, Surround Sound', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 8, 2005', 'Actors': 'Prince, Morris Day, Jerome Benton, Ingrid Chavez, The Time', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English, French', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'Prince', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: U need 2 remember this was the 80's trend to make a " movie" from all ur songs & MTV videos....u gotta luv it 4 what it is PRINCE
Review Title: U need 2 remember this was the 80's trend to ...
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------

Graffiti Bridge
Prince  (Actor, Director, Writer),     Morris Day  (Actor)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Music Artists, Prince
['Product Description', 'Graffiti Bridge (DVD)', 'In a sequel of sorts to Purple Rain, the artist formerly known as Princestruggles musically with Morris Day for control of the nightclub thatthe two co-own in this dramatic musical fantasy. There is the power offaith--in oneself and in a higher power. There is the power of love.There is the never-ending struggle between good and bad. And there isthe power of music. Graffiti Bridge.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', "A sort of fairy-tale sequel to Prince's enormously successful", 'Purple Rain', ", 1990's", 'Graffiti Bridge', "finds his purple highness not only singing and acting, but writing and directing, too. His performance suffers on all fronts. The film isn't a disaster, but it's safe to predict completist fans will make up most of its viewers. In the earlier film, Prince (known as the Kid) was fighting for his place on stage. This time he's fighting to keep his club safe from the money-grubbing hands of his musical rival, the Time's Morris Day, now a nightclub mogul. Day embodies spiritual, sexual, and economic corruption, while the Kid stands for salvation through music and a more redemptive form of lust.", 'The graffiti bridge conceit--a metaphor for a place of rejuvenation and artistic inspiration--is intriguing. Unfortunately, the bridge itself is merely a prop in a Paisley Park soundstage. Where', 'Purple Rain', 'was a movie that set new standards for lensing musical performances,', 'Graffiti Bridge', 'feels like a music video masquerading as a movie. Lucky for us, Prince cast the honey-voiced poet and performer Ingrid Chavez as Aura, part muse and part angel to both Day and the Kid. Her beauty and charisma ignite every frame she graces.', '--Michael Mikesell', 'Set Contains:', 'Bonus features are minimal but apt: a surprisingly good movie trailer and a quartet of relevant music videos, three drawn from the film and one, "Question of U," a characteristically electric concert clip.', '--Michael Mikesell', 'See more']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary**

- **Preference for Quality**: The user consistently seeks quality products, reflected in their overall average rating of 4.1, complemented by a more critical recent rating of 3.0. Their latest interaction demonstrates a growing appreciation for nostalgic artistry, reinforcing their discerning perspective.

- **Interest in Artistry and Emotional Connection**: While the user is captivated by iconic musical figures, they continue to engage with diverse storytelling, as seen in their discussions on narrative complexity and the emotional power of music. Their recent feedback showcases a recognition of historical context in artistic expression.

- **Simplicity and Accessibility**: The user has shown an evolving acceptance of subtitled and nuanced content, indicating a willingness to explore more intricate storytelling while maintaining a preference for accessibility.

- **Sensitivity to Cultural Context**: Engagement with themes reflecting societal issues, such as struggle and redemption, suggests an ongoing readiness to explore deeper emotional narratives and cultural critiques.

- **Engagement with Nostalgic and Diverse Content**: The user displays a unique openness to various genres, particularly those with historical significance or cultural references, complementing their respect for artistic integrity and emotional resonance. This trend indicates a blend of nostalgia and a desire for meaningful engagement with content.

This profile encapsulates a user who values emotional depth and artistry while embracing a broader spectrum of storytelling that connects to personal and cultural histories.
